keys.name: SIMPLE
keys.title: File conforms to the FITS standard
keys.description: The SIMPLE keyword is required to be the first keyword in the primary header of all standard FITS files and is not permitted in extension headers. The value shall contain a logical constant with the value T if the file conforms to the FITS standard.

keys.name: BITPIX
keys.title: Indicates the size of each data value
keys.description: The value field shall contain an integer. The absolute value of the integer is used to construct the size of data structures. The values must be 0 for the primary header.

keys.name: NAXIS
keys.title: Indicates the number of axes in the data array
keys.description: The value field shall contain a non-negative integer no greater than 999 representing the number of axes in the associated data array. A value of 0 indicates that no data follow the header in the HDU.

keys.name: EXTEND
keys.title: FITS file can contain conforming extensions following the Primary HDU
keys.description: TMT FITS files always contain extensions. The EXTEND keyword should always be included with a value set to T.

keys.name: NEXTEND
keys.title: Number of extensions in the FITS file
keys.description: Value indicates the number of FITS extensions in the MEF file.

keys.name: INSTRUME
keys.title: Instrument Indentifier
keys.description: A minimal header keyword identifying the TMT instrument used to acquire the data associated with the header.

keys.name: TELESCOP
keys.title: Telescope indentifier
keys.description: A minimal header keyword identifying that the TMT telescope was used to acquire the data associated with the header.

keys.name: TIMESYS
keys.title: The time scale of all time related keywords
keys.description: The value field contains a character-string code for the time scale of the time-related keywords. For TMT, this value must always be 'UTC'.

keys.name: DATE-BEG
keys.title: The start time of data acquisition
keys.description: The value field of this keyword contains a string in ISO-8601 format that specifies the start time of data acquisition in the time system specified by the TIMESYS keyword.

attributes.name: source
attributes.value: Creator of the FITS file - reads clock time

keys.name: DATE-END
keys.title: The end time of data acquisition
keys.description: The value field of this keyword contains a string in ISO-8601 format that specifies the end time of data acquisition in the time system specified by the TIMESYS keyword.

attributes.name: source
attributes.value: Creator of the FITS file - reads clock time

keys.name: EXPOSID
keys.title: The TMT exposure ID for the data
keys.description: Keyword value is a string that is the TMT-standard ExposureId for the exposure. Format must follow the TMT specification.

attributes.name: source
attributes.value: Creator of the FITS file - Exposure ID is provided by ESW to the detector system.

keys.name: END
keys.title: Indicates the end of the header
keys.description: The END keyword has no associated value. Bytes 9 through 80 shall be filled with ASCII spaces (decimal 32 or hex- adecimal 20). The END keyword marks the logical end of the header and must occur in the last 2880-byte FITS block of the header.

keys.name: DATE
keys.title: [yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ssssss] UTC date file created
keys.description: The UTC date and time when the HDU was created, in the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss, where YYYY shall be the four-digit calendar year number, MM the two-digit month number with January given by 01 and December by 12, and DD the two-digit day of the month. The literal T shall separate the date and time, hh shall be the two-digit hour in the day, mm the two-digit number of minutes after the hour, and ss.ssssss the number of seconds (two digits followed by a fraction accurate to microseconds) after the minute. Default values must not be given to any portion of the date/time string, and leading zeros must not be omitted.

attributes.name: calculation
attributes.value: Operating system time in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss

keys.name: ORIGIN
keys.title: institution responsible for creating FITS file
keys.description: Identifies the organization or institution responsible for creating the FITS file.

keys.name: TITLE
keys.title: Proposal title
keys.description: Proposal title. The proposal title can have a length of up to 150 characters. This is longer than the 68 characters available to a single FITS keyword value. The TITLE keyword will use the FITS long string value convention to end incomplete values with an ampersand and continue the value in next record with a CONTINUE element.

keys.name: PI_NAME
keys.title: Principal investigator name
keys.description: Name of principal investigator (last, first, mi). For JWST, the PI_NAME keyword concatenates the Principle Investigator last name, suffix (if any), first name, and middle initial into a comma separated value string for a single keyword.

keys.name: SIMPLE
keys.title: Data conform to FITS standard
keys.description: The SIMPLE keyword is required to be the first keyword in the primary header of all standard FITS files and is not permitted in extention headers. The value shall contain a logical constant with the value T if the file conforms to this standard.

keys.name: BITPIX
keys.title: bits per data value
keys.description: The value field shall contain an integer that specifies the number of bits that represent a data value in the associated data array. BITPIX = 0 for the primary header. For an image extension, 16 is uncalibrated and -32 is calibrated. For group information captured in an ASCII table extension BITPIX = 8, denoting that the array contains ASCII characters.

keys.name: DATE
keys.title: [yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ssssss] UTC date file created
keys.description: The UTC date and time when the HDU was created, in the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss, where YYYY shall be the four-digit calendar year number, MM the two-digit month number with January given by 01 and December by 12, and DD the two-digit day of the month. The literal T shall separate the date and time, hh shall be the two-digit hour in the day, mm the two-digit number of minutes after the hour, and ss.ssssss the number of seconds (two digits followed by a fraction accurate to microseconds) after the minute. Default values must not be given to any portion of the date/time string, and leading zeros must not be omitted.

attributes.name: calculation
attributes.value: Operating system time in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss

keys.name: ORIGIN
keys.title: institution responsible for creating FITS file
keys.description: Identifies the organization or institution responsible for creating the FITS file.

keys.name: BITPIX
keys.title: Indicates the size of each data value
keys.description: The value field shall contain an integer. The absolute value of the integer is used to construct the size of data structures. The only allowed values are in the SCI extension are: 16 for 16-bit 2's complement binary integers, 32 for 32-bit 2's complement binary integers, 64 for 64-bit 2's complement binary integers, -32 for IEEE single-precision floating point, or -64 for IEEE double-precision floating point.

keys.name: NAXIS
keys.title: Indicates the number of axes in the data array
keys.description: The value field shall contain a non-negative integer no greater than 999 representing the number of axes in the associated data array. A value of 0 indicates that no data follow the header in the HDU.

keys.name: NAXIS1
keys.title: Indicates the number of elements in the data array for axis 1
keys.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer representing the number of elements along axis n=1 of a data array. The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,..., NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=1, otherwise F

attributes.name: minimal
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=1, otherwise F

keys.name: NAXIS2
keys.title: Indicates the number of elements in the data array for axis 2
keys.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer representing the number of elements along axis n=2 of a data array. The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,..., NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=2, otherwise F

attributes.name: minimal
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=2, otherwise F

keys.name: NAXIS3
keys.title: Indicates the number of elements in the data array for axis 3
keys.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer representing the number of elements along axis n=3 of a data array. The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,..., NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=3, otherwise F

attributes.name: minimal
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=3, otherwise F

keys.name: NAXIS4
keys.title: Indicates the number of elements in the data array for axis 4
keys.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer representing the number of elements along axis n=4 of a data array. The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,..., NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=4, otherwise F

attributes.name: minimal
attributes.value: T if data has NAXIS>=4, otherwise F

keys.name: END
keys.title: Indicates the end of the header
keys.description: The END keyword has no associated value. Bytes 9 through 80 shall be filled with ASCII spaces (decimal 32 or hex- adecimal 20). The END keyword marks the logical end of the header and must occur in the last 2880-byte FITS block of the header.

keys.name: DATE
keys.title: [yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ssssss] UTC date file created
keys.description: The UTC date and time when the HDU was created, in the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss, where YYYY shall be the four-digit calendar year number, MM the two-digit month number with January given by 01 and December by 12, and DD the two-digit day of the month. The literal T shall separate the date and time, hh shall be the two-digit hour in the day, mm the two-digit number of minutes after the hour, and ss.ssssss the number of seconds (two digits followed by a fraction accurate to microseconds) after the minute. Default values must not be given to any portion of the date/time string, and leading zeros must not be omitted.
